critique: This executive order pertains to the permanency of promotions and reassignments of permanent employees within the civil service. It authorizes the Civil Service Commission and heads of executive departments/agencies to issue regulations or instructions governing these personnel actions. There is no clear indication of ideological bias, immigration stance, or impact on national security vs. civil liberties. The order seems neutral regarding federalism and economic regulation. It does not obviously expand executive power, as it delegates authority to existing bodies (Civil Service Commission, department heads) to manage internal personnel matters. It also doesn't directly address social inclusion or diversity.
